intro: Hamosa pertenuis, commonly known as the slender hamosa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
